sentences.sContent: In the not too distant future.When the pup had grown lanky and frolicsome—the wolf would return to the mountainside.
sentences.sContent_eng: In the not too distant future.When the pup had grown lanky and frolicsome—the wolf would return to the mountainside.
sentences.sCn: 在不远的将来，当小狗崽长到可以四处奔跑嬉戏的时候——狼会回到山坡。

sentences.sContent: Grass was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1999 for his "frolicsome black fables [which] portray the forgotten face of history".
sentences.sContent_eng: Grass was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1999 for his "frolicsome black fables [which] portray the forgotten face of history".
sentences.sCn: 格拉斯因他“嬉闹的黑色寓言、描绘历史被遗忘的一面”获得1999年诺贝尔文学奖。

trans.tranCn: 爱闹着玩的, 嬉戏的
trans.tranOther: given to frolicking; merry and playful
